summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on July 8, 2020, to an unnamed attorney. It demands testimony and documents related to the purchase of a property in Bradford, NH, by Granite Reality, LLC, and specifically requests records referencing Ghislaine Maxwell. The subpoena is part of a criminal investigation into violations of federal sex trafficking and related statutes.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signs the subpoena cover letter and the subpoena itself as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, overseeing the grand jury investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Explicitly named in the subpoena's rider as a person for whom all related records must be produced regarding the property transaction.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is authorizing a grand jury subpoena that specifically seeks records related to Ghislaine Maxwell in connection with a property transaction.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date the subpoenaed attorney is commanded to appear before the federal grand jury in New York to testify.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena was issued and signed by Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an active federal grand jury investigation into suspected felonies under statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2423(a) (transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity), and 2422(b) (coercion and enticement).
The investigation is seeking documents related to the purchase of a specific property in Bradford, New Hampshire, by an entity called Granite Reality, LLC.
The subpoena explicitly commands the production of all records 'related to or referencing Ghislaine Maxwell,' directly linking her to the financial transaction under investigation.
The U.S. Attorney's office requested confidentiality, asking the recipient not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to preserve the investigation.
